messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: [spam] Re: question about how people learn about unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Yahoo has a new spam filter. This has been happening on other lists as well. You can turn it off, but I m not sure how and I m not sure if it has to be done by
messages.messageBody:
Yahoo has a new spam filter. This has been happening on other lists as well.

You can turn it off, but I'm not sure how and I'm not sure if it has to be done by individual members, or the moderators.

Kristen

From: Lisa H
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, February 06, 2004 12:12 AM
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: [spam] Re: question about how people learn about unschooling


Does anyone know why the past several emails from arcarpenter2003 keep

messages.messageBody:
Yes, I'm getting them this way, too. I figured someone (moderator) needs
to go push some button at Yahoo! to tell them it's OK. My sense is that
some combination of keywords and message length or something flags it.

:-) Diane

messages.subject: SpamGuard -- was question about how people learn about unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: It s not that email address in particular, but Wednesday evening Yahoo implemented its SpamGuard program.  On some other lists that I moderate every message
messages.messageBody:
It's not that email address in particular, but Wednesday evening Yahoo
implemented its "SpamGuard" program. On some other lists that I
moderate every message was coming through marked as spam. There was no
rhyme nor reason to it either. LOL As the group owner/moderator of my
smallish groups I just chose to shut the darn thing off. HTH
-Tracy-

On Feb 6, 2004, at 12:12 AM, Lisa H wrote:

> Does anyone know why the past several emails from arcarpenter2003 keep
> coming in to my inbox as an attachment with [spam] as part of the
> subject?

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: [spam] Re: question about how	people learn about unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... Yes. My guess is that Yahoo just installed some spam identifying software and it s picking up false clues in some people s messages. I m not really sure
messages.messageBody:
on 2/6/04 12:12 AM, Lisa H at Lmanathome@... wrote:

> Does anyone know why the past several emails from arcarpenter2003 keep
> coming in to my inbox as an attachment with [spam] as part of the subject?
> See below. Is this happening to others?

Yes.

My guess is that Yahoo just installed some spam identifying software and
it's picking up false clues in some people's messages.

I'm not really sure what the purpose is of sending out messages marked with
[spam]. If the sofware were perfect, Yahoo you just not send it or we could
set our email programs to filter it all into the trash. But it isn't perfect
so we still have to read all the mail to decide if it's spam or not.

Joyce
